paragraphs.body: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience (${link_0}) is an interactive e-book based on the animated series ${link_1} that features exclusive production content from the ${link_2} as well as new material from the ${link_3}. The book also contains concept art, design works, and hidden content.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience (ISBN 978-1-61263-394-7) is an interactive e-book based on the animated series The Legend of Korra that features exclusive production content from the first book as well as new material from the second book. The book also contains concept art, design works, and hidden content.

paragraphs.body: The book was made available for free download on July 2, 2013. It consists of 85 pages, split into eight chapters of the aforementioned material, most of which had never been revealed to the public before. An iPad is required to view the content through the iBooks application, as the e-book was made specifically for digital reading.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience

paragraphs.body: The backstory is a short excerpt that describes the changes that occurred in the Avatar World following the end of the ${link_0}. ${link_1} ${link_2} and ${link_3} ${link_4} worked together to restore peace and balance among the ${link_5} by forming the ${link_6}, a fifth nation created from the ${link_7} where benders and nonbenders from all walks of life could live together harmoniously. The capital, ${link_8}, is a site of exponential technological advancement.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: The backstory is a short excerpt that describes the changes that occurred in the Avatar World following the end of the Hundred Year War. Avatar Aang and Fire Lord Zuko worked together to restore peace and balance among the four nations by forming the United Republic of Nations, a fifth nation created from the Fire Nation colonies where benders and nonbenders from all walks of life could live together harmoniously. The capital, Republic City, is a site of exponential technological advancement.

paragraphs.body: It is also revealed that Aang and ${link_0} married and eventually had three children: ${link_1}, ${link_2}, and ${link_3}. Aang trained Tenzin in the art of ${link_4} and passed down to him the teachings of the ${link_5}. The two restored the four air temples and established ${link_6} in Republic City, where the nonbending ${link_7} settled and lived according to Air Nomad culture.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: It is also revealed that Aang and Katara married and eventually had three children: Kya, Bumi, and Tenzin. Aang trained Tenzin in the art of airbending and passed down to him the teachings of the Air Nomads. The two restored the four air temples and established Air Temple Island in Republic City, where the nonbending Air Acolytes settled and lived according to Air Nomad culture.

paragraphs.body: To safeguard his next incarnation, Aang enlisted the help of the ${link_0}. He died at the age of 66, and was reincarnated into the ${link_1} as ${link_2}.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: To safeguard his next incarnation, Aang enlisted the help of the Order of the White Lotus. He died at the age of 66, and was reincarnated into the Southern Water Tribe as Korra.

paragraphs.body: The chapter guide features a brief synopsis for each episode of the first book, along with initial frame sketches and final screen captures for particular scenes. Each episode also provides a preliminary animatic, a sequence created from a series of still images edited together and displayed with initial dialogue and music. An external link to purchase each episode on iTunes is also located on the bottom left corner of each page.

links.body: The Legend of Korra—The Art of the Animated Series, Book One: Air

section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: This chapter includes a brief bio for the main characters featured in the first book, including the members of Team Avatar, Tenzin, Katara, Lin Beifong, and Amon. Several pieces of concept art are also included for viewing. The end of the chapter features minor characters including Councilman Tarrlok, General Iroh, Pema, Hiroshi Sato, and Tenzin's three children. An external link to purchase The Legend of Korra—The Art of the Animated Series, Book One: Air is also located in each page.

paragraphs.body: This chapter focuses on the emergence of the United Republic of Nations following the ${link_0}. It provides both conceptual and finalized panoramic shots of Republic City. A section also focuses on the origins of ${link_1} in Republic City, and a complete copy of the rule book along with a complete list of competing pro-bending teams is accessible from the side. Concept art and final screen captures of other notable landmarks in Republic City are also provided, including Air Temple Island and ${link_2}.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: This chapter focuses on the emergence of the United Republic of Nations following the Harmony Restoration Movement. It provides both conceptual and finalized panoramic shots of Republic City. A section also focuses on the origins of pro-bending in Republic City, and a complete copy of the rule book along with a complete list of competing pro-bending teams is accessible from the side. Concept art and final screen captures of other notable landmarks in Republic City are also provided, including Air Temple Island and Aang Memorial Island.

paragraphs.body: This chapter is similar to the chapter guide in that it features panels from early development, along with a single scene storyboard sequence for each episode. The final cut of each scene is superimposed onto the bottom right corner of the storyboard sequence so that a comparison between development and post-production can be easily made.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience

The final cut of each scene is superimposed onto the bottom right corner of the storyboard sequence so that a comparison between development and post-production can be easily made.

paragraphs.body: This chapter features new exclusive content from the second book, including character bios, animatics, and the title card for the first episode, "${link_0}". An animatic on page 73 shows Bolin leading the new ${link_1} to defeat in a pro-bending match, Mako pursuing a pair of criminals as part of Republic City's police force, Asami attempting to reinvigorate ${link_2}, and Korra using the Avatar State to win an air scooter race against Tenzin's children.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
Chapter Six: Book Two first look
paragraphs.text: This chapter features new exclusive content from the second book, including character bios, animatics, and the title card for the first episode, "Rebel Spirit". An animatic on page 73 shows Bolin leading the new Fire Ferrets to defeat in a pro-bending match, Mako pursuing a pair of criminals as part of Republic City's police force, Asami attempting to reinvigorate Future Industries, and Korra using the Avatar State to win an air scooter race against Tenzin's children.

paragraphs.body: A character section also reveals more information about Korra's father, ${link_0}, and introduces new characters from the second book, including Korra's cousins ${link_1}, ${link_2} ${link_3}, ${link_4}, and a ${link_5}, a supernatural entity that serves as an antagonist in the second book.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
Chapter Six: Book Two first look
paragraphs.text: A character section also reveals more information about Korra's father, Tonraq, and introduces new characters from the second book, including Korra's cousins Desna and Eska, Chief Unalaq, Varrick, and a dark spirit, a supernatural entity that serves as an antagonist in the second book.

paragraphs.body: This chapter provides external links to various social media, including Korra Nation on tumblr and the official series page on Facebook. Links are also provided for The Legend of Korra iTunes page, where episodes of the first book and the art book are available for purchase.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
Chapter Seven: Fan guide to Korra
paragraphs.text: This chapter provides external links to various social media, including Korra Nation on tumblr and the official series page on Facebook. Links are also provided for The Legend of Korra iTunes page, where episodes of the first book and the art book are available for purchase.

paragraphs.body: This chapter recognizes the contributions of series founders ${link_0} and ${link_1}, along with illustrators ${link_2} and ${link_3}, who designed and provided a large majority of the production content featured in the book.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: This chapter recognizes the contributions of series founders Bryan Konietzko and Michael Dante DiMartino, along with illustrators Joaquim Dos Santos and Ki Hyun Ryu, who designed and provided a large majority of the production content featured in the book.

paragraphs.body: On page 51, clicking either ${link_0}'s, ${link_1}'s, or ${link_2}'s image will reveal a hidden video clip from "${link_3}" of the three children aiding Lin Beifong in battling ${link_4} at Air Temple Island.
section: The Legend of Korra: Enhanced Experience
paragraphs.text: On page 51, clicking either Jinora's, Ikki's, or Meelo's image will reveal a hidden video clip from "Turning the Tides" of the three children aiding Lin Beifong in battling Equalists at Air Temple Island.
